entry.title: Move the caret by "paragraph" granularity should cross editing boundary
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 120.0.6099.126 OS: Platform independent, all platforms(macOS/Windows/Linux...) can reproduce this issue
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open https://codepen.io/Peng-Zhou/pen/LYabZVR. (2) Ensure that p#two is rendered into two distinct lines. (3) Move the caret at the end of p#two, then click the button
What is the expected result? The caret moves to the end of p#one.
What happens instead? The behavior looks "line" granularity, the caret only moves to the previous line.

entry.title: Profile IPH no longer showing
entry.content:
After creating a new profile, there was an IPH shown: go/spaces-iph
it looks like this no longer works

entry.title: [UniversalInstall] Arrow points the wrong for RTL locales
entry.content: When you switch to RTL mode (Developer Mode Settings on Android > Force RTL Layout Settings) the install arrow and the create shortcut arrow in the Universal Install dialog point inward (they should be flipped so they point outward).

entry.title: Add specification link for resourceid and initiatorid
entry.content:
The attributes resourceID and initiatorID are currently not specified in the w3c resource timing specification. Once these attributes are properly specified, it would be beneficial to include a link in the codebase for improved readability. This update should be made in the third_party/blink/public/mojom/timing/resource_timing.mojom file.
Porject Explainer : https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ODMUQP9ua-0plxe0XhDds6aPCe_paZS6Cz1h1wdYiKU/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: [Non-Regression][MultiMoniter]: Observed blank screen while connecting/disconnecting the multi-display
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M122 Beta #122.0.6261.21/15753.13.0 on Kled(Hatch) device LaCrOS Version : LaCrOS Dev RC #124.0.6315.2[LaCrOS-Only] OS: Chrome
Details: ----------------------------------------------------- 1)Accounts: Test account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: NO 3)Devices: Corp device Kled(Hatch) -X86/LaCros64 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: yes-M122 Beta #122.0.6261.21/15753.13.0 on Kled(Hatch) device 5)Mode: Normal mode 6)Frequency: Always
Enabled the lacros flags #lacros-stability = Dev #lacros-only = Enabled #enable-component-updater-test-request = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch Lacros 2. Try to Connect the device to external moniter and Observe
What is the expected result? There should not be any screen blinking or glitches when connecting and disconnecting to multi monitor
What happens instead? Observed screen blinking when connecting and disconnecting to Multi-monitor
Note: 1) Issue is also seen in ash-chrome
This issue is also seen on M111 Stable #111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 on Lava(Coral) device

entry.title: The tab is opened in new window with the window being half of the normal/usual size after dragging it out from full screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.2 (Official Build) canary (arm64) ee77acc178bb8175e0f0b1967d1bd0bbcc9d5a82-refs/branch-heads/6312@{#6}
OS: Mac(11.4)
Feature Bug : https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326422875
Test Plan - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ED_otHAVJCpb_-5VqeO67F1673aHRO6HUwvQwxZOBjw/ ￼
Precondition : launching Chrome with --enable-features="ImmersiveFullscreen" #enable-immersive-fullscreen-toolbar from chrome://flags
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2. Open any website(ex: amazon.in or flipkart.com) in new tab 3. Enter full screen 4. Drag the tab out to open in new window 5. Observe the window size of the newly opened window
Actual Result : The tab is opened in new window with the window being half of the normal/usual size
Expected Result : The tab must be opened in new window with normal/usual size
Kindly refer the attached screencast
@bur : Could you please look into this.
Thanks!

entry.title: Eye dropper is not working in DevTools color picker, in wayland
entry.content:
We use the native 'Eye Dropper' API whenever it is available by detecting whether the feature is available (by `'EyeDropper' in window`).
However, in Linux Wayland, the feature is reported available and we try to use it even though the feature is not correctly working there (b/40800718).
As a solution: * The feature should not be reported available in Wayland until it is properly implemented.
As a workaround on DevTools side: * We're going to bring back the EyeDropper experiment for people to use a workaround to disable using native eye dropper.
It would have been better if we could understand whether the feature is working correctly on DevTools side and automatically disable it if it is not working; however, it seems like there is no way to do this on JS side.
See the user report: https://x.com/ChallengesCss/status/1760391573064347703?s=20

entry.title: Now offline we want to see the file, not download it again
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem When online, open some page in a new tab in set. Now offline go back to that tab.
# Problem Description When we were online we long tapped a link and told it to open it in a new tab in the same set. Now we are offline and want to look at that tab. But you don't give us the choice to see the file that got downloaded! We just simply want to see the file that got downloaded right from this tab without having to go looking downloads. The choice is just missing from this image that you see. By the way entering this bug using a cell phone is a terrible terrible pain. Really should have a new bug entry system that works on cell phones. Not just desktops.
# Additional Comments On a cell phone I can hardly see what I'm trying to type in this box.
# Summary Now offline we want to see the file, not download it again
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Remove cancel call in autofill session once we drop Android O support
entry.content: Remove the extra cancel call [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/android_autofill/browser/java/src/org/chromium/components/autofill/AutofillProvider.java;l=263) once we stop supporting Android O.

entry.title: Merge related SupervisedUserPreferences methods
entry.content:
There are currently three very similar methods in [components/supervised_user/core/browser/supervised_user_preferences.h](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/supervised_user/core/browser/supervised_user_preferences.h):
* IsChildAccount() * IsSubjectToParentalControls() * IsUrlFilteringEnabled()
After the full launch of parental controls, they now return the same on all platforms (i.e. whether the user is supervised). We should remove 1-2 of these, and update the comments to make it clear which should be used when.

entry.title: New Updater does not work with Proxy Server policy
entry.content: We noticed some of our devices no longer installing updates for Chrome. Some users reported an error message while manually checking the version of Chrome (help/about). "update_client::ProtocolError::URL_FETCHER_FAILED. (error code 7: 0XFFFFD8EB -- system level" Further analysis showed that all clients were the google updater was updated (omaha 4?) had the same update issue. Our clients need to a proxy server to connect to the internet and we defined that years ago via Group Policy. Earlier this week several other 1000 clients got the new updater and they now show the same issue. Checking with our network team we see no network traffic occurring at all from the devices when checking for updates, proxy server logs also no trace of any attempts. Testing the update URL via curl -v and the correct proxy works just fine. Removing the proxy policies and placing the device on a network that doesn't require proxies also leads to the updater working fine. The logs do indicate it recognizes the policies and it 'says' it will use them. But there's no log entries showing it actually did (unlike the older log files) I've attached the updater log file for analysis

entry.title: Request interception for worker requests leaks into the page target
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M122
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) See repro in https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/11985
What is the expected result? Puppeteer does not enable Network or Fetch for worker targets.
What happens instead? The requests from the worker (webworkerproxy.aspx) are being intercepted on the page target session. They also contain a networkId although network domain has not been enabled for the worker.

entry.title: Performance panel > Layout shifts > Related Node is gone from report
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 OS : Windows 10 Enterprise
What steps will reproduce the problem? Go to DevTools "Performance" panel, make a recording of a website, like https://www.daca-ledscreen.be/led-scherm-huren
What is the expected result? There is a "Layout shift" lane in the report. It shows you when a layout shift happened and under "Summary" it will tell you Where From and To the element shifted (position + size). See: https://web.dev/articles/debug-layout-shifts#performance_panel In earlier DevTools versions, the "Related Node" attribute showed you which DOM element was being shifted. And it allowed to jump into the "Elements" panel right where the DOM element is located.
What happens instead? The "Related Node" attribute is missing. Confirmed on Twitter (X), Barry Pollard said he experiences the same.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Inspect page does not work on MacOS when undocked.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Launch the browser and navigate to, say, www.google.com 2. Hit F12 to open the DevTools pane. If it's already floating, skip to #4. 3. On the DevTools pane, click on the three dots on the upper-right and select Undock into separete window (first option) 4. Select the DevTools window by clicking on the titlebar 5. Click on the inspect button on the upper-left (the one with the arrow) 6. Move the mouse cursor over the page content while keeping the DevTools window selected -> You'll notice the inspect feature doesn't working 7. Select the browser window by clicking on the titlebar 8. Move the mouse cursor over the page content -> The inspect feature works in this case
# Problem Description Bug description:
To replicate the bug, do the following: 1. Launch the browser and navigate to, say, www.google.com 2. Hit F12 to open the DevTools pane. If it's already floating, skip to #4. 3. On the DevTools pane, click on the three dots on the upper-right and select Undock into separete window (first option) 4. Select the DevTools window by clicking on the titlebar 5. Click on the inspect button on the upper-left (the one with the arrow) 6. Move the mouse cursor over the page content while keeping the DevTools window selected -> You'll notice the inspect feature doesn't working 7. Select the browser window by clicking on the titlebar 8. Move the mouse cursor over the page content -> The inspect feature works in this case
When the feature isn't working, blink reports only kMouseLeave events when inspecting the page content.
Mac mini (M1, 2020) macOS Sonoma 14.1.1 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ [x] Google Chrome 121.0.6167.184 (Official Build) (arm64) [x] Google Chrome Beta 122.0.6261.49 (Official Build) beta (arm64) [x] Google Chrome Dev 123.0.6300.3 (Official Build) dev (arm64) [x] Microsoft Edge 121.0.2277.128 (Official build) (arm64) [x] Microsoft Edge Beta 122.0.2365.38 (Official build) Beta (arm64) [x] Microsoft Edge Dev 123.0.2400.1 (Official build) Dev (arm64) [x] Brave v1.62.165 Chromium: 121.0.6167.184 (Official Build) (arm64) [x] Brave Beta 1.64.74 Chromium: 122.0.6261.43 (Official Build) beta (arm64)
MacBook Pro (16-inch, 2019) macOS Ventura 13.5.1 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ [x] Google Chrome 121.0.6167.184 (Official Build) (x86_64) [x] Google Chrome Beta 122.0.6261.49 (Official Build) beta (x86_64) [x] Google Chrome Dev 123.0.6300.3 (Official Build) dev (x86_64)
# Additional Comments This feature works on Windows as expected.
# Summary Inspect page does not work on MacOS when undocked.
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Come up with a design for addressing Angular DevTools requirements across multiple iframes
entry.content:
By the end of Q1 we should have a design for the (DevTools) Extension API that meets the needs of Angular DevTools for
* inspecting elements, * opening source, and * inspecting function property inspection
across `<iframe>`s, as outlined in [Chrome DevTools Inspected Window API Limitations ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12guWC9tTpcXlTOinz7CWq-Fal05q12GNvbBgafSZc-s).
The current options seem to be:
1. Teach `chrome.devtools.inspectedWindow.eval()` about frame IDs and expose a way to map the frame IDs that fall out of `chrome.scripting` to the frame IDs that `chrome.devtools` uses (these are different IDs). 1. Teach `chrome.scripting.evaluateScript()` about the [Console Utilities APIs](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/console/utilities) that are needed by Angular DevTools.
Both options have downsides and aren't trivial.

entry.title: The first selected language only showing after changing to other languages
entry.content:
Chrome Version :124.0.6316.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: M122 Rollout) Revision :b26aa52e7baaa4a74e0d3ed434826dd84c7c2fce-refs/branch-heads/6316@{#1}
OS: Win(10,11), Mac
Pre Conditions: Login Successfully
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Go to Settings and select Languages 2. Select Hindi in Google Translate in to this Language. 3. Add German to Automatically translate these languages. 4. Go to ebay.de and Observe it is showing in Hindi. 5. Go to Lanugages and select Telugu as Tranlate in to this Language. 6. Go to ebay.de site and Observe it is not tranlating the selected language.
Actual Result : The first selected language only showing after changing to other languages
Expected Result : The selected language needs to show after changing the Language.
This Issue is exists from M-113 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/13yIoXGbHH628ljYSdjQ8TU9MuESf4_bG/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: wayland: ChromiumRefresh2023 right click menu broken on beta
entry.content:
Reproducer video is included in the attachments. The binary used in the video is built from main but it can also be reproduced on 123 beta.
Environment: - GNOME 45 with 1.5x display scale - Fedora 39
How to reproduce: - Right click
Expected behavior: - Menu works normally
Actual behavior: - The first entry in the menu is automatically activated
Suspected cause: [CL:5205030](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5205030) broke the calculation used by [ui::GetOriginInScreen](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.cc;l=92;drc=70e628cc669ddafe7f881f3e61dbc1edd67a4ee0)

entry.title: desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia steamId is not usable in Chrome extension MV3 offscreen document
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a Chrome Extension 2. Call desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia from the service worker to get a stream id 3. Send it to an offscreen document and call getUserMedia with the stream id 4. Observe "DOMException: Invalid state" error when trying to use a stream id with getUserMedia from chooseDesktopMedia.
# Problem Description I have a Chrome extension which has been updated to manifest v3 and it previously used the extension api desktopCapture. This is no longer possible with manifest v3 and I have had to move to the getDisplayMedia web API. Now that I am using this API I have had many bug reports for my extension because the select what to share dialog is not very user friendly as it can easily be missed.
A similar change was made for the tabCapture api.
Please see the following for more info: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-extensions/c/3RanHldyp9c https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326508296
# Summary desktopCapture.chooseDesktopMedia steamId is not usable in Chrome extension MV3 offscreen document
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>GetUserMedia
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Improvements to getDisplayMedia web api from a Chrome extension offscreen document.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Call navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia from an offscreen document in a Chrome extension. 2. Observe that the dialog can easily be missed and can not be cancelled. 3.
# Problem Description Please add the following improvements to navigator.mediaDevices.getDisplayMedia when used from an offscreen document from a Chrome Extension: - Allow the request to be cancelled. - Enable control over where the dialog appears or always display it on the window which is currently focused by the user.
Context: I have a Chrome extension which has been updated to manifest v3 and it previously used the extension api desktopCapture. This is no longer possible with manifest v3 and I have had to move to the getDisplayMedia web API. Now that I am using this API I have had many bug reports for my extension because the select what to share dialog can easily be missed due to the following: - If using multiple monitors it opens on the main monitor instead of the focused window. - It takes awhile to open - If you click on the window as soon as it opens it is hidden from view. Another issue is that it is not cancellable and while the dialog is open no other streams can be opened.
Please see https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-extensions/c/3RanHldyp9c from more info.
# Summary Improvements to getDisplayMedia web api from a Chrome extension offscreen document.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>GetUserMedia
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Partner organization members (Jetbrains) cannot access skia issue tracker bugs.
entry.content:
Members of our partner organization (Jetbrains) have recently started getting errors when attempting to access the skia issue tracker bugs. Example: https://issues.skia.org/issues/324465764. It seems like maybe a recent permissions change?
They are able to see the issue from incognito and from their personal gmail account, just not from their partner google account. I think it's all bugs in the Skia tracker, they are able to see bugs from our other buganizer tracker (eg. partnerissuetracker.corp.google.com).
The possibility that this was related to age verification was raised, but sending the user to https://myaccount.google.com/age-verification says "you're all set" screen that says "you don't need to take any action because your Google Account doesn't require age verification", so that doesn't appear to be the issue.
The entire team compose team at Jetbrains is experiencing the inability to access the issue. If you're looking at the logs, the user we've been working with while attempting to debug is alexander.maryanovsky@jetbrains.com so he should show up in the logs.

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback (webxr)
entry.content:
*--------------- Template 1 ------------------*
My name is Sahilsher Singh, and I am a 2025 Computer Science and Engineering student interested in contributing to the project focused on enhancing the WebXR Internals debugging page for the Google Summer of Code (GSoC) program.
Upon reviewing the project description, I am excited about the opportunity to build upon the foundation laid by the previous GSoC contributor and to further improve the WebXR Internals debugging page. The prospect of delving into real-time diagnostic information and high-level performance metrics aligns perfectly with my interests and academic background.
Here's a brief overview of my understanding of the project goals:
1) Last year's GSoC contributor initiated the framework for the WebXR Internals debugging page, incorporating logic to log session requests, active runtimes, and high-level metrics about XR sessions. 2) The goal for this year is to enhance the debugging page by integrating more diagnostic information in real-time, including live logs and high-level performance metrics such as live framerate and tracking dropped frames. 3) Additionally, there is a need to extend these metrics to include potential feedback mechanisms for the Google Cardboard VR runtime, as well as exploring the implementation of additional metrics for monitoring the general health of webpages.
I am particularly drawn to this project due to its focus on improving the debugging capabilities and performance monitoring of WebXR applications. As someone passionate about web technologies and virtual reality, I have prior experience in C++, Java, TypeScript and also Access to Android phone which I think would be a perfect fit for this.
As I prepare to embark on this journey, I would greatly appreciate your guidance on the following points:
1) How can I familiarize myself with the existing framework and codebase for the WebXR Internals debugging page? 2) Are there any specific technologies or tools that I should be proficient in or familiarize myself with before starting the project? 3)What are the key areas of focus or priority tasks that you envision for the enhancement of the debugging page during the GSoC period? 4) Are there any particular challenges or considerations that I should be aware of as I begin working on this project? 5) How can we establish effective communication and collaboration throughout the duration of the GSoC program?
I am genuinely excited about the opportunity to contribute to this project and work alongside you and the project team to achieve our shared objectives.
